intro: Cineraria geifolia, commonly known as the white cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features silvery-green, fuzzy leaves and produces showy, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
